newsitem.title: JAPAN: Microsoft plans Japan version of Net sale software.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft plans Japan version of Net sale software.

text.p: Microsoft Co Ltd, a Japanese unit of U.S. software giant Microsoft Corp, said on Thursday it would offer a Japanese version of its Merchant Server software for businesses to sell products over the Internet.

A Microsoft spokesman said the Japanese version of its Merchant Server Version 1.0 will go on sale on February 3 in Japan, following the launch of the original version in the United States earlier this year.

Server licences will cost 1.95 million yen and administration licences, required to host a live domain, will be 480,000 yen, it said in a statement. But it will offer administration licences at a special price of 320,000 yen during a campaign period until next June 30.
Merchant Server enables companies to establish selling sites on the Internet's World Wide Web with minimal development costs, the company said.
